# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using ThreadsX

function pig_latinify(strings::Vector{String})
    results = Vector{String}(undef, length(strings))

    @sync @threads for i in 1:length(strings)
        word = strings[i]
        if length(word) > 1
            results[i] = word[2:end] * word[1] * "ay"
        else
            results[i] = word * "ay"
        end
    end

    return results
end
```

This function uses `ThreadsX.jl` to enable thread-safe operations. It creates a vector of the same length as the input vector to store the pig latin words. It then iterates over each string, moving the first character to the end and appending "ay". This operation is performed on a separate thread for each string to improve performance.
